medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ten years prior, the patient experienced labored breathing with activity, which progressed from climbing stairs to walking on level ground. The dyspnea improved temporarily, but 30 months before this evaluation, he developed fatigue, malaise, sore throat, rhinorrhea, and arthralgias. Twelve months prior, he reported exertional dyspnea, first noted while climbing stairs, which progressed to dyspnea with less exertion. Six months before evaluation, a nuclear stress test indicated distal anterior ischemia, and dyspnea continued.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, coronary-artery calcifications, right bundle-branch block, osteoarthritis of the knees and shoulders, prostatic hypertrophy, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and previous surgeries including right carotid endarterectomy, right total knee replacement, removal of tubular adenoma of the colon, and Mohs surgery for basal-cell carcinomas.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at 54 years of age; mother had basal-cell carcinoma; no family history of lung or autoimmune disease.
medical_history.social_history: Former smoker (one pack per day for 10 years, quitting over 40 years ago; five cigars per week for 15 years, quitting five years ago). Consumes one serving of liquor daily with dinner. No known occupational or inhalational exposures. Previously resided in the Midwest and southeastern United States; currently lives in coastal Massachusetts.
